name: Sandia Casino & Resort

reviews.title: Dont pass this up!
reviews.text: We received an offer(promo) in the mail from Harrah's to stay two nights at Sandia..I went online and checked reviews because it sounded too good to be true. The reviews were not favorable so we decided maybe we would stay just one night to check it out,play golf, and then head over to the Hyatt Tamaya for a few more days. We were pleasantly surprised at how friendly the staff was.We had an early t-time so no time to check in and they were very accomodating with our luggage. Although a challenge, the course was VERY well maintained and absolutely beautiful!Not to mention very inexpensive. The home made potato chips

are something we will crave till our next visit! The rooms are very comfortable and well appointed.The next day we checked in at the Hyatt and within a few hours were calling Sandia(which was totally booked) to see if we could come back! They managed to find a room for us AND at the promo price from Harrah's. We loved Sandia and are already planning our next trip!

reviews.text: I stayed at the resort for 5 nights and paid for my mother to stay for 4 nights in her own room. The first 4 nights of my stay were quite nice other than losing too much money at the table games.
reviews.title: Nice Stay...Nothing Spectacular

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On my last evening at the resort, after eating a fairly nice filet in the steakhouse, I went up to my room to freshen up only to find that I was locked out and that someone had been in my room and stuck a door tag between the door and the latch (I assume to get my attention). I went down to the front desk to find out why after 4 nights I was locked out of my room.

reviews.text: Please note: I am a very generous person - I always generously tip everyone - the valets, the beverage staff, the dealers, the waitstaff, etc.
reviews.title: Great Golf and Value

description: Spectacular Sandia Resort and Casino offers a refined and sophisticated atmosphere inspired by New Mexico's pueblo culture. A striking cobblestone porte-cochere entry greets arriving hotel guests, who are welcomed into the grand lobby highlighted by the mountain view and unique architecture featuring native pottery and art. Whether you are here to game, dine, golf or relax at the Green Reed spa, you will discover something new around each corner.
